title: Variceal Upper Gastrointestinal Bleeding
diagnosis_topic: Esophageal or gastric variceal hemorrhage secondary to portal hypertension
setup_script: “A 54-year-old man with known alcoholic cirrhosis presents with large-volume hematemesis and melena. He is hypotensive and confused. How would you manage this patient?”

dynamic_flow.reply: “Patient is altered with poor gag reflex; intubated for airway protection and resuscitation.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident initiates fluid resuscitation and transfusion
dynamic_flow.reply: “Two large-bore IVs placed; transfusion initiated; Hgb goal 7–8 g/dL.”
“Patient becomes increasingly hypotensive to 70/40 mmHg and tachycardic to 140 bpm.”
“Octreotide infusion started; blood pressure stabilizes modestly.”
“Large clots aspirated; confirms upper GI source.”
“Endoscopic variceal band ligation performed; bleeding controlled.”
“Patient continues to bleed with hemodynamic instability.”
“Persistent bleeding; balloon tamponade placed temporarily; TIPS considered.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident evaluates for hepatic encephalopathy
dynamic_flow.reply: “After bleeding controlled, patient develops confusion; lactulose initiated.”
“Nonselective beta blockers and repeat banding recommended.”
“Patient develops aspiration pneumonia and recurrent bleeding.”

critical_decision_points: Initiation of vasoactive therapy and prophylactic antibiotics
Rescue therapy if endoscopy fails (balloon tamponade, TIPS)
Post-bleed management: secondary prophylaxis and transplant evaluation
